perturbation.original_text: MMT and SIGA shall each, at their sole cost and expense, procure and maintain (a) commercial general liability insurance in amounts not less than $[***] per incident and $[***] annual aggregate, and (c) product liability insurance in amounts not less than $[***] annual aggregate, and each naming the other Party as additional insured. MMT and SIGA shall maintain such insurance throughout the Term, and shall from time to time provide copies of certificates of such insurance the other Party upon request.
perturbation.changed_text: MMT and SIGA shall each, at their sole cost and expense, procure and maintain commercial general liability insurance and product liability insurance, each naming the other Party as additional insured. MMT and SIGA shall maintain such insurance throughout the Term.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of specific insurance coverage amounts weakens the obligation, contradicting standard business practices and potentially violating implied duties of good faith and fair dealing. Removing the requirement to provide certificates of insurance eliminates a crucial compliance measure. Insurance requirements are essential, and laws usually mandate that a certain insurance coverage should be in place. By omitting these requirements, this creates legal risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duties of good faith and fair dealing, standard business practices regarding insurance coverage.

perturbation.explanation: This modification removes critical implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, non-infringement, or non-misappropriation. Omitting these could violate consumer protection laws that imply these warranties, creating legal risk for misleading business practices regarding the products being provided under contract. This can expose the party to legal liability and create a legal loophole.

perturbation.original_text:
In forwarding Safety Reports to SIGA, Promoter shall comply with all applicable privacy and data protection laws, rules and regulations on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of Personal Data and the free movement of such data. "Personal Data" means information that can be used by itself or in combination with other available information to identify a specific individual. The Promoter shall collect, use and disclose any Personal Data obtained in the course of performing the safety related activities under this Agreement solely for the purposes of complying with the regulatory obligations as described in this Agreement, or as otherwise required by law or by a court order. Promoter shall use electronic, physical, and other safeguards appropriate to the nature of the information to prevent any use or disclosure of Personal Data other than as provided for by this Agreement. Promoter will also take reasonable precautions to protect the Personal Data from alteration or destruction.

Promoter shall notify SIGA promptly of any accidental, unauthorized, or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, or disclosure of, or access to, the Personal Data ("Security Breach"), and take immediate steps to rectify any Security Breach.
perturbation.changed_text: In forwarding Safety Reports to SIGA, Promoter shall comply with all applicable privacy and data protection laws, rules and regulations on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of Personal Data. "Personal Data" means information that can be used by itself or in combination with other available information to identify a specific individual. The Promoter shall collect, use and disclose any Personal Data obtained in the course of performing the safety related activities under this Agreement solely for the purposes of complying with the regulatory obligations as described in this Agreement. Promoter will also take reasonable precautions to protect the Personal Data from alteration or destruction.
perturbation.explanation: The section requiring the Promoter to take reasonable precautions to protect personal data from 'use or disclosure of Personal Data other than as provided for by this Agreement' has been omitted. The omission of the need to notify SIGA of a 'Security Breach' creates legal risk for privacy and security regarding data and information between the parties. This can expose the parties to legal liability and create a legal loophole.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) , California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), other data privacy laws.
